POLICY_COMMENTS_SEARCH: The way this thing works is simple, it will create an HTML page every time you search. This HTML page will do the following in order: style a black page with text indicating your search is submitted and what engine is used (determined later), creates a blank and heavily isolated iframe (this will be used to submit the search), generates a list of instances (predefined), generates a random number (cryptographically secure just because), gets the html document and writes to it a form containing the user's query and the randomly generated index of the list of instances using the post method, then it submits that form (which will redirect to the results page).
Note: THIS WILL PREVENT YOU FROM USING ANY OTHER SEARCH ENGINES AS YOUR DEFAULT! Also, search suggestions are impossible.

SECURITY NOTICE: It may be possible to craft a malicious search query that can lead to arbitrary script execution. This is highly unlikely to be an issue but worth the note if you are potentially targeted. This is improved upon by using iframe sandboxing to submit the form but this is mild in effectiveness and only increases complexity of the input required to bypass this.
